intro: Lespedeza thunbergii var. albiflora, commonly known as white-flowered lespeDEZA, is a perennial herb native to East Asia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant is noted for its clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges and open areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits, it is cultivated in gardens and used in erosion control.
